entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Thunderstorms and downpours possible until Wednesday evening. Note, northerly rain through to Wednesday evening, followed by southerly rain overnight Wednesday. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Watch period extended to 3am on Thursday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain, with highest accumulations expected east of Opotiki. Peak intensities 15 to 25 mm/h, but possibly 25 to 40 mm/h in localised areas. Thunderstorms and downpours possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain with thunderstorms and localised downpours possible. Amounts may approach warning criteria, and possibly exceed them in downpours. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain with thunderstorms and localised downpours possible. Amounts may approach warning criteria or possibly exceed them in downpours. Note, heavy rain is expect to clear for a time late morning. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: Unstable showery conditions spread southwards onto the upper North Island today, with a moderate risk of thunderstorms over Northland and Auckland. Some of these thunderstorms may become SEVERE across eastern parts of Northland this morning and early afternoon, then Auckland around midday and through the afternoon, with localised downpours of 25 to 40 mm/h, large hail in excess of 20 mm diameter, strong wind gusts of 90 km/h, and a slight chance of a damaging tornado. Expect thunderstorm activity to ease by evening.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
